unnormalised: New Delhi - India's telecommunications sector is bracing for significant changes in data plan offerings, spurred by a surge in mobile data consumption. Experts at IIT-Bombay predict a 30% increase in average data usage per subscriber over the next year, fueled by increased streaming of content and adoption of digital services.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio are reportedly re-evaluating their existing plans to cater to the evolving needs of consumers. Industry analysts suggest that we might see plans tailored for specific use cases, like gaming and OTT platforms. The move comes after users complained about data depletion while binging on web series and movies, much like Raju's struggle with his internet speed in the Bollywood hit "3 Idiots".

unnormalised: Vodafone Idea, currently facing financial headwinds, is expected to announce competitive plans to retain its subscriber base. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is closely monitoring the situation to ensure fair pricing and consumer protection. The expected change in data plans could affect the average revenue per user by Rs. 15-20. Many hope affordable data plans will facilitate the digitization of remote areas like Bastar, connecting them to the digital India vision.
